019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
022import io.kubernetes.client.apimachinery.GroupVersionKind;
023import io.kubernetes.client.custom.V1Patch;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
025import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.Configuration;
026import java.io.IOException;
027import java.nio.file.Files;
028import java.nio.file.Path;
029import java.time.Instant;
030import java.util.logging.Level;
031import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
032import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
033import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sClient;
034import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicStub;
035import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmDefinitionStub;
036import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.ChannelManager;
037import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.Exit;
038import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.ModifyVm;
039import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.UpdateAssignment;
040import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmChannel;
041import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
042import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
043import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
044import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
045import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
046import org.jgrapes.core.events.HandlingError;
047import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
048import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
049
050/**
051 * Implements a controller as defined in the
052 * [Operator Whitepaper](https://github.com/cncf/tag-app-delivery/blob/eece8f7307f2970f46f100f51932db106db46968/operator-wg/whitepaper/Operator-WhitePaper_v1-0.md#operator-components-in-kubernetes).
053 * 
054 * The implementation splits the controller in two components. The
055 * {@link VmMonitor} and the {@link Reconciler}. The former watches
056 * the VM definitions (CRs) and generates {@link VmDefChanged} events
057 * when they change. The latter handles the changes and reconciles the
058 * resources in the cluster.
059 * 
060 * The controller itself supports a single configuration property:
061 * ```yaml
062 * "/Manager":
063 *   "/Controller":
064 *     namespace: vmop-dev
065 * ```
066 * This may only be set when running the Manager (and thus the Controller)
067 * outside a container during development.  
068 * 
069 * ![Controller components](controller-components.svg)
070 * 
071 * @startuml controller-components.svg
072 * skinparam component {
073 *   BackGroundColor #FEFECE
074 *   BorderColor #A80036
075 *   BorderThickness 1.25
076 *   BackgroundColor<<internal>> #F1F1F1
077 *   BorderColor<<internal>> #181818
078 *   BorderThickness<<internal>> 1
079 * }
080 * 
081 * [Controller]
082 * [Controller] *--> [VmWatcher]
083 * [Controller] *--> [Reconciler]
084 * @enduml
085 */
086public class Controller extends Component {
087
088    private String namespace;
089
090    /**
091     * Creates a new instance.
092     */
093    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConstructorCallsOverridableMethod")
094    public Controller(Channel componentChannel) {
095        super(componentChannel);
096        // Prepare component tree
097        ChannelManager<String, VmChannel, ?> chanMgr
098            = new ChannelManager<>(name -> {
099                try {
100                    return new VmChannel(channel(), newEventPipeline(),
101                        new K8sClient());
102                } catch (IOException e) {
103                    logger.log(Level.SEVERE, e, () -> "Failed to create client"
104                        + " for handling changes: " + e.getMessage());
105                    return null;
106                }
107            });
108        attach(new VmMonitor(channel(), chanMgr));
109        attach(new DisplaySecretMonitor(channel(), chanMgr));
110        // Currently, we don't use the IP assigned by the load balancer
111        // to access the VM's console. Might change in the future.
112        // attach(new ServiceMonitor(channel()).channelManager(chanMgr));
113        attach(new Reconciler(channel()));
114        attach(new PoolMonitor(channel()));
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Special handling of {@link ApiException} thrown by handlers.
119     *
120     * @param event the event
121     */
122    @Handler(channels = Channel.class)
123    public void onHandlingError(HandlingError event) {
124        if (event.throwable() instanceof ApiException exc) {
125            logger.log(Level.WARNING, exc,
126                () -> "Problem accessing kubernetes: " + exc.getResponseBody());
127            event.stop();
128        }
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Configure the component.
133     *
134     * @param event the event
135     */
136    @Handler
137    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event) {
138        event.structured(componentPath()).ifPresent(c -> {
139            if (c.containsKey("namespace")) {
140                namespace = (String) c.get("namespace");
141            }
142        });
143    }
144
145    /**
146     * Handle the start event. Has higher priority because it configures
147     * the default Kubernetes client.
148     *
149     * @param event the event
150     * @throws IOException 
151     * @throws ApiException 
152     */
153    @Handler(priority = 100)
154    public void onStart(Start event) throws IOException, ApiException {
155        // Make sure to use thread specific client
156        // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/100
157        Configuration.setDefaultApiClient(null);
158
159        // Verify that a namespace has been configured
160        if (namespace == null) {
161            var path = Path
162                .of("/var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/namespace");
163            if (Files.isReadable(path)) {
164                namespace = Files.lines(path).findFirst().orElse(null);
165                fire(new ConfigurationUpdate().add(componentPath(), "namespace",
166                    namespace));
167            }
168        }
169        if (namespace == null) {
170            logger.severe(() -> "Namespace to control not configured and"
171                + " no file in kubernetes directory.");
172            event.cancel(true);
173            fire(new Exit(2));
174            return;
175        }
176        logger.fine(() -> "Controlling namespace \"" + namespace + "\".");
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * On modify vm.
181     *
182     * @param event the event
183     * @throws ApiException the api exception
184     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
185     */
186    @Handler
187    public void onModifyVm(ModifyVm event, VmChannel channel)
188            throws ApiException, IOException {
189        patchVmDef(channel.client(), event.name(), "spec/vm/" + event.path(),
190            event.value());
191    }
192
193    private void patchVmDef(K8sClient client, String name, String path,
194            Object value) throws ApiException, IOException {
195        var vmStub = K8sDynamicStub.get(client,
196            new GroupVersionKind(VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM), namespace,
197            name);
198
199        // Patch running
200        String valueAsText = value instanceof String
201            ? "\"" + value + "\""
202            : value.toString();
203        var res = vmStub.patch(V1Patch.PATCH_FORMAT_JSON_PATCH,
204            new V1Patch("[{\"op\": \"replace\", \"path\": \"/"
205                + path + "\", \"value\": " + valueAsText + "}]"),
206            client.defaultPatchOptions());
207        if (!res.isPresent()) {
208            logger.warning(
209                () -> "Cannot patch definition for Vm " + vmStub.name());
210        }
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Update the assignment information in the status of the VM CR.
215     *
216     * @param event the event
217     * @param channel the channel
218     * @throws ApiException the api exception
219     */
220    @Handler
221    public void onUpdatedAssignment(UpdateAssignment event, VmChannel channel)
222            throws ApiException {
223        var vmDef = channel.vmDefinition();
224        var vmStub = VmDefinitionStub.get(channel.client(),
225            new GroupVersionKind(VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM),
226            vmDef.namespace(), vmDef.name());
227        vmStub.updateStatus(from -> {
228            JsonObject status = from.statusJson();
229            var assignment = GsonPtr.to(status).to("assignment");
230            assignment.set("pool", event.usedPool());
231            assignment.set("user", event.toUser());
232            assignment.set("lastUsed", Instant.now().toString());
233            return status;
234        });
235        event.setResult(true);
236    }
237}
